input_sentence: At intersections and junctions if there is another vehicle in right of ego and there is no traffic light in front of ego then ego must yield to other vehicle, provided there is no traffic sign number 206 in front of ego.

atomic_propositions.description: Other vehicle is on right side of ego
Traffic light is in front of ego
Sign 206 is in front of ego

temporal_relations.description: At intersection/junction with vehicle on right, no traffic light in front, and no sign 206 in front, ego must yield

stage_results.agent_response:
Reasoning Process:
1. Extract object mapping from objects list:
   - obj_ego → ego
   - obj_other → other  
   - obj_traffic_light → traffic_light
   - obj_sign_206 → sign_206

2. Construct predicate(object) forms for each atomic proposition:
   - ap_1: at_intersection(ego)
   - ap_2: at_junction(ego)
   - ap_3: in_right_of(other,ego)
   - ap_4: in_front_of(traffic_light,ego)
   - ap_5: yield(ego,other)
   - ap_6: in_front_of(sign_206,ego)

3. Map the conditional temporal relation using predicate(object) forms:
   - Antecedent: (at_intersection(ego) | at_junction(ego)) & in_right_of(other,ego) & ~in_front_of(traffic_light,ego) & ~in_front_of(sign_206,ego)
   - Consequent: yield(ego,other)

4. Apply global property "Always" using G operator

Final MTL Formula:
G (((at_intersection(ego) | at_junction(ego)) & in_right_of(other,ego) & ~in_front_of(traffic_light,ego) & ~in_front_of(sign_206,ego)) -> yield(ego,other))

synthesis_result.synthesis_reasoning:
1. Extract object mapping from objects list:
   - obj_ego → ego
   - obj_other → other  
   - obj_traffic_light → traffic_light
   - obj_sign_206 → sign_206

2. Construct predicate(object) forms for each atomic proposition:
   - ap_1: at_intersection(ego)
   - ap_2: at_junction(ego)
   - ap_3: in_right_of(other,ego)
   - ap_4: in_front_of(traffic_light,ego)
   - ap_5: yield(ego,other)
   - ap_6: in_front_of(sign_206,ego)

3. Map the conditional temporal relation using predicate(object) forms:
   - Antecedent: (at_intersection(ego) | at_junction(ego)) & in_right_of(other,ego) & ~in_front_of(traffic_light,ego) & ~in_front_of(sign_206,ego)
   - Consequent: yield(ego,other)

4. Apply global property "Always" using G operator

stage_results.agent_response:
Reasoning Process:
[I first identify the main structure of the formula: G(antecedent -> consequent), meaning "Always, if [conditions], then [action]". 

Breaking down the antecedent:
- at_intersection(ego) → "ego is at an intersection"
- at_junction(ego) → "ego is at a junction" 
- in_right_of(other,ego) → "another vehicle is on the right side of ego"
- ~in_front_of(traffic_light,ego) → "there is no traffic light in front of ego"
- ~in_front_of(sign_206,ego) → "there is no sign 206 in front of ego"

The consequent:
- yield(ego,other) → "ego yields to the other vehicle"

All conditions are connected with logical AND (&), forming a compound condition. The temporal operator G indicates this rule applies globally/always.]

Natural Language Translation:
[Always, if the ego vehicle is at an intersection or junction, and another vehicle is on the right side of the ego vehicle, and there is no traffic light in front of the ego vehicle, and there is no sign 206 in front of the ego vehicle, then the ego vehicle must yield to the other vehicle.]

verification_result.back_translation: [Always, if the ego vehicle is at an intersection or junction, and another vehicle is on the right side of the ego vehicle, and there is no traffic light in front of the ego vehicle, and there is no sign 206 in front of the ego vehicle, then the ego vehicle must yield to the other vehicle.]
verification_result.verification_reasoning:
[I first identify the main structure of the formula: G(antecedent -> consequent), meaning "Always, if [conditions], then [action]". 

Breaking down the antecedent:
- at_intersection(ego) → "ego is at an intersection"
- at_junction(ego) → "ego is at a junction" 
- in_right_of(other,ego) → "another vehicle is on the right side of ego"
- ~in_front_of(traffic_light,ego) → "there is no traffic light in front of ego"
- ~in_front_of(sign_206,ego) → "there is no sign 206 in front of ego"

The consequent:
- yield(ego,other) → "ego yields to the other vehicle"

All conditions are connected with logical AND (&), forming a compound condition. The temporal operator G indicates this rule applies globally/always.]

analyst.name: Analyst_Agent
analyst.description: Responsible for deconstructing natural language into structured semantic components

synthesizer.name: Synthesizer_Agent
synthesizer.description: Responsible for synthesizing syntactically correct MTL formulas from semantic components

verifier.name: Verifier_Agent
verifier.description: Responsible for verifying the semantic correctness of MTL formulas through back-translation
